image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Yahya Sinwar named Hamas leader: What does his appointment mean for Gaza-Israel tensions?
item.description: Hamas announced Yahya Sinwar as its new political leader on Tuesday, following the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh. Sinwar, accused of masterminding the October 7 attack on Israel, is one of Israel's most wanted militants. The Ezzedine Al-Qassam Brigades subsequently fired rockets towards Israel from the Gaza Strip.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barack Obama hails Tim Walz as 'exceptional' VP pick: 'Michelle and I couldn't be ...'
item.description: Former President Barack Obama endorsed Minnesota governor Tim Walz as Vice President, emphasising his inclusive government approach. Obama praised Walz's pandemic recovery efforts, paid family leave, abortion rights protection, and gun safety measures. Obama conveyed his belief in Walz's suitability following Kamala Harris's selection of Walz as her running mate for the US election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why did Royals blast Harry and Meghan citing ‘utter contempt’ towards the King?
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle planned a visit to Colombia after an invitation from Vice President Francia Márquez. Courtiers argued this visit strained their relationship with the royal family, accusing them of depicting themselves as British royals. The trip raised questions due to Colombia's high murder rate and Harry's ongoing security concerns in the UK.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Black man dies in Milwaukee hotel incident: 4 employees charged in case resonates with George Floyd's tragedy
item.description: Four Milwaukee hotel employees were charged with felony murder following D’Vontaye Mitchell’s death after they forcibly restrained him for eight to nine minutes. Mitchell, who struggled to breathe, ultimately succumbed to restraint asphyxia. The autopsy revealed drug use and morbid obesity as contributing factors. Arrest warrants have been issued for the employees involved.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel FM calls to 'swiftly eliminate' new Hamas leader and 'arch-terrorist' Yahya Sinwar
item.description: Israel’s foreign minister Israel Katz on Tuesday called for the swift elimination of Yahya Sinwar, the new Hamas political leader. Sinwar, seen as a key figure behind the October 7 attack on Israel, was appointed after Ismail Haniyeh's death. Katz described Sinwar as an 'arch-terrorist' and emphasized the need to eradicate Hamas entirely. Sinwar's history and influence within Hamas make him a significant target for Israel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: The day after, celebration & chaos on streets of Bangladesh
item.description: Following the ouster of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, Bangladesh witnessed mass protests and violent clashes. Protesters celebrated the dissolution of parliament, while unrest escalated, leading to numerous deaths and escape of prisoners. The military reshuffled commanders, and garment factories prepared to reopen, as life in Dhaka showed signs of returning to normalcy.

item.title: Did Netflix donate $7 million to Kamala Harris's campaign?

item.title: X sues advertisers over alleged billion-dollar boycott; Elon Musk declares 'Now it is war'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Venezuelan President Maduro attacks social media, claims 'cyber-fascist' coup bid
item.description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro criticized social media platforms like WhatsApp, TikTok, and Instagram for spreading footage and information about protests against his reelection. The protests erupted after the election results were declared, leading to fatalities and numerous detentions. Maduro accused the platforms of promoting hatred and division and urged for social media regulation.

item.title: Trump and Musk to hold an exclusive interview ahead of election
item.description: Former President Donald Trump announced an interview with Elon Musk, scheduled for next Monday night. The interview comes as Musk publicly endorses Trump's re-election bid, amidst political tensions and allegations. Both Trump and Musk have criticized perceived biases against Trump. Meanwhile, Kamala Harris has chosen Tim Walz as her running mate for the upcoming election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris and Tim Walz do make an interesting team because...: What JD Vance said
item.description: ​ “To her credit, Kamala Harris and Tim Walz do make an interesting team because if we remember the rioting in the summer of 2020, Tim Walz was the guy who let rioters burn down Minneapolis and then Kamala Harris was the one who bailed the rioters out of jail,” he said referring to the Black Live Matter protest triggered after George Floyd was killed by the Minneapolis police.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Asif Merchant? Pakistani man with ties to Iran charged in assassination plots in US
item.description: ​A 46-year-old Pakistani man, Asif Merchant, has been charged by the US Department of Justice for plotting to kill politicians, government officials on the US soil. Prosecutors in Brooklyn announced criminal charges against Asif Merchant, accusing him of travelling to New York for the purposes of trying to hire a hitman for the assassinations. The plot was disrupted before it could be carried out. The document did not name any potential target but CNN reported that former president Donald Trump and other current and former US government officials might be the targets of the plot.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: A Donald Trump-Elon Musk interview is coming! Details to follow, says ex-president
item.description: Former president Donald Trump announced Tuesday that he will sit with X owner, Tesla CEO Elon Musk next Tuesday for an interview in the run up to the November election for which Musk has already endorsed the Republican presidential candidate. “ON MONDAY NIGHT I’LL BE DOING A MAJOR INTERVIEW WITH ELON MUSK — Details to follow,” Trump posted on Truth Social.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I could smell the burning tires': Wife of Kamala Harris' VP pick slammed for old interview
item.description: Kamala Harris' running mate Tim Walz was accused of allowing Minnesota burn during the George Floyd riots in 2020. Now as his name was announced as Kamala Harris' running mate in the November election, a clip of his wife Gwen Walz speaking about the Black Lives Matter protest has gone viral with the Republicans claiming that the whole family is 'sick'.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Van Jones says Kamala Harris picked Tim Walz over Josh Shapiro because...
item.description: CNN commentator Van Jones said Tuesday that Pennsylvania governor Josh Shapiro was sidestepped by Kamala Harris because he is Jewish. Kamala Harris picking Minnesota governor Tim Walz "was her caving in to some of these darker parts in the party" in terms of appeasing "anti-Jewish bigots" that have "gotten marbled into this party", Van Jones said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Tim Walz spoke about IVF, 'chidlless cat ladies'
item.description: Tim Walz is not a 'childless cat lady' as JD Vance would like to describe some Democrats but the father of two is very open about his wife's struggle to conceive and then opting for IVF to become parents. Tim and Gwen Walz have two children : 23-year-old Hope and 17-year-old Gus Walz.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
